articles.description: BRIGHTON, Colo. (AP) — Colorado paramedic gets five years in prison for death of Elijah McClain in rare prosecution of medical responders.
articles.title: Colorado paramedic gets five years in prison for death of Elijah McClain in rare prosecution of medical responders

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and BASSEM MROUE
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The head of a Gaza City hospital that treated some of the Palestinians wounded in the bloodshed surrounding an aid convoy said Friday that more than 80% had been struck by gunfire, suggesting there was heavy shooting by Israeli troops.
articles.title: Gaza doctor says gunfire accounted for 80% of the wounds at his hospital from aid convoy bloodshed

articles.author: ZEKE MILLER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden on Friday announced that the U.S. will begin airdropping sorely needed humanitarian assistance into Gaza amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas war.
articles.title: US to airdrop humanitarian aid into Gaza — how it can help and why it's so complicated

articles.author: DASHA LITVINOVA and KATIE MARIE DAVIES
articles.description: Under a heavy police presence, thousands of people bade farewell Friday to opposition leader Alexei Navalny at his funeral in Moscow after his still-unexplained death two weeks ago in an Arctic penal colony.
articles.title: Putin foe Alexei Navalny is buried in Moscow as thousands attend under a heavy police presence

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Thousands of mourners gathered in Moscow to bid farewell to Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny on Friday, two weeks after his still-unexplained death in an Arctic penal colony.
articles.title: AP PHOTOS: Russians say final farewell at funeral of opposition leader Alexei Navalny

articles.author: SEAN MURPHY and JIM VERTUNO
articles.description: STINNETT, Texas (AP) — Wildfires may have destroyed as many as 500 structures in the Texas Panhandle, Republican Gov. Greg Abbott said Friday, describing how the largest blaze in state history scorched everything in its path, leaving ashes in its wake.
articles.title: Gov. Abbott says Texas wildfires may have destroyed up to 500 structures

articles.author: CHRISTINE FERNANDO
articles.description: CHICAGO (AP) — The recent ruling in Alabama that frozen embryos are legally considered children created a political firestorm after the decision halted treatment for many couples seeking to have families through fertility treatments.
articles.title: Alabama IVF ruling highlights importance of state supreme court races in this year's US elections

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: A federal appeals court in Washington has ordered a new sentence for a retired Air Force officer who stormed the U.S.
articles.title: Appeals court ruling that vacates Capitol rioter's sentence could impact dozens of Jan. 6 cases

articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The judge overseeing the Georgia election interference case against Donald Trump indicated Friday that he would rule within the next two weeks on whether to remove Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis from the case over a romantic relationship with a top prosecutor.
articles.title: Judge indicates he will rule within next 2 weeks on bid to remove Fani Willis from Trump case

articles.author: MICHAEL HILL
articles.description: FORT EDWARD, N.Y. (AP) — A man who fatally shot a 20-year-old woman after the SUV she was riding in mistakenly drove into his rural driveway in upstate New York was sentenced Friday to more than 25 years to life in prison.
articles.title: New York man who killed a woman after a wrong turn in his driveway gets 25 years to life
